result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case  20CT72, 21CF357, 21CM151, 22CF50, 22CF75, and recites appearances.  Court calls case and recites appearances. 11:01 AM Defendant Mindi Lynn Wilber appeared by video from the Barron County Jail.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Mindi Lynn Wilber. Court calls case and recites appearances. 
Atty Pollak makes comment on no longer being able to represent the Defendant due to conflict. Currently looking for a new attorney to represent her. 
Court makes a status conference to determine if she has received an attorney by that time.

Notice of Removal from Waitlist(Over Capacity) - Justice Point
Arraignment on April 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:28 AM Defendant Mindi Lynn Wilber in court with attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak appears by zoom.  Defendant Mindi Lynn Wilber in custody appears by video.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by zoom for the State of Wisconsin.    Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Pollak indicates to proceed with preliminary hearing.   State calls witness Sgt Mike Woller,   State request Court take judicial notice of Sawyer County Bond in Case 22CF50, Attny Pollak no objection,  Court takes judicial notice.   Court sworn in witness.   State begins examination.    11:31 AM  Witness identified the DEF, court indicates the record will reflect.  State continues examination.   11:34 AM  Cross-Examination by Attorney Pollak.  11;35 AM  Witness excused.   No further witness by either party.   State request for bind over.  Attny Pollak no arguement.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  

  Arraignment scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-338-3976 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   Attny Pollak request preliminary hearing to be set within time limits.
